description: estimated maximum photosynthetic rates at 25 degC

Equation: specific to pft but note that b1Bl_small(1:4)   = 0.0 and b1Bl_large(:)     = b1Bl_small(:)
description: DBH-leaf allometry slope for all cohorts. All PFTs. (There is small and large.)

Equation: specific to pft but note that b2Bl_small(1:4)   = 0.0 and b2Bl_large(:)     = b2Bl_small(:)
description: DBH-leaf allometry slope for all cohorts. All PFTs. (There is small and large.)

Equation: bleaf = ifelse( dbhuse %<% pft$dbh.adult[zpft] , pft$b1Bl.small[zpft] /C2B * dbhuse ^ pft$b2Bl.small[zpft] , pft$b1Bl.large[zpft] /C2B * dbhuse ^ pft$b2Bl.large[zpft] )#end ifelse
description: Leaf biomass
Carbon-to-biomass ratio of plant tissues

Equation: specific to pft but note that hgt_min(2:4)   = 0.50
description: Minimum height of an individual
density of leaf tissue

Leaf minimum water potential based on leaf_rwc_min

Equation: specific to pft but note that  q(3)     = 1.0
description: Mass ratio between fine root and leaves

Equation: specific to pft but note that rho(3)     = 0.71   ! 0.60
description: Wood density.  Used only for tropical PFTs and grasses
Root vertical profile parameter. Fraction of root biomass below max root depth
citation: Jackson, R. B., J. Canadell, et al. (1996). ! "A global analysis of root distributions for terrestrial ! biomes." Oecologia 108(3): 389-411.

description: RWC at turgor loss point for sapwood

Equation: specific to pft but note that SLA( 3) = 10.0**(sla_inter + sla_slope * log10(12.0/leaf_turnover_rate( 3))) * sla_scale
description: Specific Leaf Area

Equation: SRA(1:17)   = 24. * 2. ! m2/kgC --> this is from Amazon
description: Specific Root Area
Sensitivity of stoma_lambda to leaf water potential
Marginal water use efficiency under well-watered conditions in the optimization based stomatal model
citation: Katul et al. 2010 Annals of Botany, Manoni et al. 2011 Functional Ecology

description: Water potential scaler to modify stomatal conductance under water stress
Exponent to modify stomatal conductance under water stress

Equation: vessel_curl_factor(1:17)  = 1.5 (This is kind of arbitrary, total hydraulic path is 50% more than tree height)
description: Ratio of actual vessel length (water conducting length) to tree height

Equation: specific to pft but note that  Vm0(3) = 12.500000 * ssfact * vmfact_c3 = 12.5 * 3.0 *  1.0 = 37.5
description: Maximum photosynthetic capacity at a reference temperature. Vcmax
